publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2388 Bob Doris: Congratulations to Councillor Dornan—That the Parliament congratulates Councillor James Dornan on his election to the post of leader of the SNP group on Glasgow City Council; notes that the vacancy was created by the stunning success of the SNP in having former group leader, John Mason, elected as Scotland’s newest Member of the UK Parliament; wishes Councillor Dornan and his team well; is confident that he can lead the group to victory in Glasgow at the next council elections; calls on all council groups in Glasgow City Council to work with the Scottish Government to deliver on the joint concordat commitments; hopes that the ruling Labour group in Glasgow City Council will make a genuine attempt to implement the historic concordat with the Scottish Government, and is confident that the SNP opposition group will keep the pressure on Labour in Glasgow to deliver on a range of commitments including reducing class sizes and kinship care payments, two areas where Glasgow Labour has been too slow and SNP MSPs and councillors have been pushing for action. Supported by: Michael Matheson*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Bashir Ahmad*, Stuart McMillan*, Alasdair Allan*, Jamie Hepburn*, Ian McKee*, Bill Kidd*, Kenneth Gibson*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-2388Congratulations to Councillor Dornan (lodged on 12 August 2008) Bill Wilson*
S3M-2388 Congratulations to Councillor Dornan (lodged on 12 August 2008) Keith Brown*
